intro: Sida quinquevalvacea, commonly known as the five-valved sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Sida quinquevalvacea is an important species for ecological studies due to its role in supporting local biodiversity.
